greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct runs in base-10 digits of n.
comment: Every positive integers occurs infinitely many times.  See A297770 for a guide to related sequences. A043562(n) = a(n) for n=1..100, but not for n=101.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 14! in base-10: 2,7,0,0,1,7,3,0,1,3,0,0; ten runs, of which 6 are distinct, so that a(14!) = 6.
xref: Cf. A043562 (number of runs, not necessarily distinct), A297770.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 03 2018
